creator: maarten_coene@yahoo.com
text:
Hi,

the <style> task doesn't support the <mapper> aliases like <globmapper>, 
<identitymapper>, etc.

For instance:
<style basedir="${build.reports}/input" 
       destdir="${build.reports}/styled"
       style="${styles.dir}/style.xsl"
       force="true">
   <globmapper from="*.xml" to="*.styled.xml" />
</style>

this throws the following exception:
BUILD FAILED
C:\temp\build.xml:53: The <style> type doesn't support the nested "globmapper" 
element.

could this be fixed please?

A workaround is to use the 'type' attribute in the <mapper> element, but this 
doesn't work for the composite and chained mappers since they don't have 
a 'type' attribute.

regards,
Maarten

Another work-around is to use the mapper without a  "type";

<mapper>
  <globmapper from="*.xml" to="*.styled.xml"/>
</mapper>
creator: peterreilly@apache.org
mbenson@apache.org
text:
Also, a <mapper> with nested <*mapper> elements implicitly IS a composite
mapper.   Types accepting e.g. <globmapper> directly is syntactic sugar
(courtesy of Peter).  Closing as WORKSFORME.  Feel free to reopen if attaching a
patch.  ;)
